titles.ar: بَابُ مَا يُكْرَهُ مِنَ الزِّينَةِ لِلْمُحْرِمِ
titles.en: Chapter 93 – What is disliked from the adornments for the one in Ihraam

titles.ar: بَابُ الْعِلَاجِ لِلْمُحْرِمِ إِذَا مَرِضَ أَوْ أَصَابَهُ جُرْحٌ أَوْ خُرَاجٌ أَوْ عِلَّةٌ
titles.en: Chapter 94 – The treatment for the one in Ihraam when he falls sick, or is hit by an injury, or pus, or a disease
Chapter 92 – The perfume for the one in Ihraam

titles.ar: بَابُ مَا يُكْرَهُ مِنَ الزِّينَةِ لِلْمُحْرِمِ
titles.en: Chapter 93 – What is disliked from the adornments for the one in Ihraam

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (7/314)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: لَا تَنْظُرْ فِي الْمِرْآةِ وَ أَنْتَ مُحْرِمٌ لِأَنَّهُ مِنَ الزِّينَةِ وَ لَا تَكْتَحِلِ الْمَرْأَةُ الْمُحْرِمَةُ بِالسَّوَادِ إِنَّ السَّوَادَ زِينَةٌ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Hammad Bin Isa, from Hareyz,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws having said: ‘You should not look into the mirror and you are in Ihraam, because it is from the adornments; and the female in Ihraam should not apply Kohl with the blackness if the blackness is an adornment’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Hammad ibn ‘Isa from Hariz who has said the following: “Abu ‘ Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘You must not look into the mirror, while you are in the state of Ihram; it is of beautification. A woman in the state of Ihram must not use kohl (eye-shadows) with black color; black is beautification.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (17/314)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيٌّ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ

text: قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) لَا يَنْظُرِ الْمُحْرِمُ فِي الْمِرْآةِ لِزِينَةٍ فَإِنْ نَظَرَ فَلْيُلَبِّ .

en.hubeali: Ali, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Muawiya Bin Ammar who said,
‘Abu Abdullahasws said: ‘The one in Ihraam cannot look into the mirror in order to adorn. So if he looks, he should exclaim Talbiyya’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Mu‘awiyah ibn ‘Ammar who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘One in the state of Ihram must not look into the mirror; if one does so, one must say the Talbiyah (here I am, O Lord, to obey Your command).”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (17/315)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيٌّ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ الْكُحْلِ لِلْمُحْرِمِ قَالَ أَمَّا بِالسَّوَادِ فَلَا وَ لَكِنْ بِالصَّبِرِ وَ الْحُضُضِ .

en.hubeali: Ali, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hammad, from Al Halby,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws, said, ‘I asked himasws about the Kohl for the one in Ihraam. Heasws said: ‘As for (applying) with the blackness, so no. But, (yes) with the Al-Sabr and Al-Huzuz (eye powders for treatment)’.
en.sarwar: 3. Ali has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Hammad from al-Halabiy who has said the following: I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about kohl for one in the state of Ihram. He (the Imam) said, ‘Not with black color but one can use it with sabr and hudod (two kinds of medicine for the eyes).”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (7/315)

narrator_chain.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ أَبَانٍ عَمَّنْ أَخْبَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِذَا اشْتَكَى الْمُحْرِمُ عَيْنَيْهِ فَلْيَكْتَحِلْ بِكُحْلٍ لَيْسَ فِيهِ مِسْكٌ وَ لَا طِيبٌ .

en.hubeali: Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moalla Bin Muhammad, from Al Hasan Bin Ali, from Aban, from the one who informed him,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws having said: ‘When the one in Ihraam complains of his eyes, so let him apply Kohl wherein is neither musk nor perfume’.
en.sarwar: 4. Al-Husayn ibn Muhammad has narrated from Mu‘alla’ ibn Muhammad from al-Hassan ibn Ali from Aban from those who narrated to him who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘If one in the state of Ihram suffers from illness in the eyes it is permissible for one to use kohl which does not have musk or perfume in it.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (7/315)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيٌّ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: الْمُحْرِمُ لَا يَكْتَحِلْ إِلَّا مِنْ وَجَعٍ وَ قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ بِأَنْ تَكْتَحِلَ وَ أَنْتَ مُحْرِمٌ بِمَا لَمْ يَكُنْ فِيهِ طِيبٌ يُوجَدُ رِيحُهُ فَأَمَّا لِلزِّينَةِ فَلَا .

en.hubeali: Ali, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Muawiya,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws having said: ‘The one in Ihraam cannot apply Kohl except for pain’. And heasws said: ‘There is no problem with if you apply Kohl and you are in Ihraam, with what does not happen to have perfume in it or its aroma is not found. But, as for adornment, so no’.
en.sarwar: 5. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Mu‘awiyah who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘One in the state of Ihram must not use kohl unless it is to cure pain.’ He (the Imam) has said, ‘Using kohl which does not have any perfume while one is in the state of Ihram is not harmful, however, for beautification it is not permissible.’”
